instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: Machook Pro - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi Team,
I have received a Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> where the computer works fine, just that the Audio does not work.  If gone on System Preferences >> Sound >> Output >> No output devices found.  Input >> No input devices found.  I thought that it could be a Software issues, so I went ahead and reformatted the hard drive and set up the computer as a New computer without customers data.  Still the computer does not show any output and input devices.  Can you help me in solving this issue.

threads.title: Machook Pro - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
Machook Pro - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
Machook Pro - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: thats your problem, restore that and youll be good, check for input, whatever enable thats required and shorts on output.

threads.title: Machook Pro - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: 4V5 analog does not need to be present as that only powers the amps/analog side of the chip. The digital side is not working as it is not recognized in the OS. Is there 5V on L6200? Check power on L6201 too.

threads.title: Machook Pro - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Hi Duke, No I am not getting 5V on L6200 and on L6201 as well I am not getting any voltage.

threads.title: Machook Pro - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
5V on L6200 comes from <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> which of course should be present otherwise the machine would not work...

If you have 5V on pin 1 from L6200 but not on pin 2, just replace L6200..

But if you dont have voltage on any pin of L6200 maybe it is a broken trace, fix it if you find it or run a wire from pin 1 of L6200 to the closest pad where you find <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>..
